item.title: R to @geoffreylitt: a full guarantee of review doesn't seem possible in the retrofitting approach. sure an automation could *claim* that it'll always ask for review, and it usually will... but how do you know?
item.dc:creator: @geoffreylitt

item.title:
R to @geoffreylitt: this seems like a huge challenge for the incremental approach of "retrofit automation on top of UIs for humans"...
what I want in a future OS: provide guarantees that certain actions will be reviewed by a human. AI automations will go speculate but we'll need to confirm.

item.title:
A puzzler:
I want to automate a monthly payment that I do manually in my bank website.
Would be a simple thing for a web UI automation. But how can I trust that to be reliable? I don‚Äôt want a robot clicking the wrong buttons on my bank.
What‚Äôs state of the art here?
